item.title: Will add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Liquor is the chloroform which enables the poor man to endure the painful operation of living." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Will add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "When I have one martini, I feel bigger, wiser, taller. When I have a second, I feel superlative. When I have more, there's no holding me." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Will add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "An alcoholic is someone you don't like, who drinks as much as you do." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: Will add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Will add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The only difference between a tax man and a taxidermist is that the taxidermist leaves the skin." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Will add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "Above all, we must realize that no arsenal, or no weapon in the arsenals of the world, is so formidable as the will and moral courage of free men and women." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Will add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Will add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Will add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Will add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Will add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Will add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Will add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Will add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Will add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Will add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The difference between genius and stupidity is; genius has its limits." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Will add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: Will add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Will add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Get busy living or get busy dying." -- Stephen King

item.title: Will add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Will add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description:
"I believe that this hairless embryo with the aching, oversize brain case and the opposable thumb, this animal barely up from the apes, will endure --will endure longer than his home planet, will spread out to the other planets, to the stars, and beyond, carrying with him his honesty, his insatiable curiosity, his unlimited courage --and his noble essential decency.
This I believe with all my heart." -- Robert A. Heinlein
